column4: question: how do I avoid having console messed with log? tried to modify /etc/syslog.conf but nothing changed
yup... but where can I confiure it?
It shouldn't need configuring. It should take all log messages by default :/
damn... it's impossible to work on the console... :|
how does your /var/log/messages set for permissions?
tried stopping *log* but still getting garbage on the console...
that would be u+rw-x g+r-xr o-xrw, right?
does the kernel logger go down and up ok when you sudo /etc/init.d/klogd restart
no way... can't stop having garbage...
looks like thos annoyng log lines come directly from kernel... or at least printks is used...
